Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to produce a list of targeted, open-ended questions. They should cover missing details, decision criteria, roles/responsibilities, timing/sequencing, exceptions. Avoid SQL queries or implementation details. Provide conceptual understanding.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: We should produce a list maybe 10-15 questions. Each question should be open-ended and specific to aspects of the process described.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let's think: The process includes: 1. Landlord contacts regional office. 2. Property coordinator reviews documentation. 3. Missing/outdated docs -> request updates. 4. Once verified, record property details into central database. 5. Assign dedicated property manager based on workload, geography specialization, experience with similar property types, track record with unique requirements. 6. Introductory call/meeting between manager and landlord to align expectations and discuss special conditions/policies (pets allowed? maintenance responsibilities? payment channels). 7. Manager schedules photographer and inspector visits; photographer for marketing; inspector for safety/habitability standards. 8. If inspector finds issues -> manager works with landlord to address them (hiring contractors or scheduling repairs). 9. Once passes inspection -> digital marketing team creates online listings; prepares brochures; updates internal pricing models based on market trends. 10. After marketing set -> property activated in rental portal & internal systems; available for prospective tenants to view/apply. 11. Manager or leasing agent handles tenant screening: applications review; credit checks; employment verification; references from previous landlords. 12. If multiple tenants interested: negotiation of lease terms; promotional discounts; prioritize longer lease commitments etc. 13. Finalize lease agreement: collect security deposit & schedule move-in date. 14 . Quality checks & internal audits: compliance officer reviews lease for fair housing regulations compliance; financial analyst verifies rental price matches pricing strategy/profitability targets ; IT department checks listing integration into system. Also mention exceptions like special insurance or custom lease clauses.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Need questions about: - How is the initial contact handled? What information is captured at first contact? - How does the coordinator verify documents? Are there standard checklists? - What is the timeline from initial contact to database entry? - How are missing/outdated docs identified? Who follows up? - How are property details captured? Are there fields that are mandatory vs optional? - Assignment criteria for property manager: how are workload metrics measured? Geographic specialization defined? Experience thresholds? Track record metrics? - Decision-making process if multiple managers eligible? - Introductory meeting content: what topics covered beyond those listed? Who attends from each side (e.g., legal counsel)? - Scheduling photographer/inspector: who coordinates scheduling logistics? Are there preferred vendors or in-house teams? - Inspection findings resolution workflow: who decides on contractor selection? Timeline for repairs before listing activation? - Marketing team responsibilities: what platforms used for listings? How often pricing models updated relative to market data sources? - Activation steps in portal/system integration – any automated triggers after marketing completion? - Tenant screening criteria thresholds (credit score ranges etc.) – how flexible across different city markets/regulations? - Handling multiple applicants – what negotiation strategies used by managers vs leasing agents vs corporate policy guidelines – Are there standard discount structures or promotional offers predetermined by company policy? Quality checks: – Compliance officer's review process – what documents reviewed beyond lease agreement – Financial analyst's verification steps – how do they assess profitability targets – IT integration check – what data fields must be validated Exceptions: – Special insurance requirements – who initiates this requirement and how integrated into onboarding – Custom lease clauses requested by landlords – how negotiated and documented

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Also ask about communication flows: – Which tools used (email threads vs CRM vs project management) – How status updates communicated across stakeholders – Escalation paths if delays occur

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Also ask about performance metrics: – Key performance indicators tracked during onboarding – Average time from start to activation

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Also ask about continuous improvement: – Feedback loops from tenants/landlords post-onboarding

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Ok produce a list of such questions. Make sure they are open-ended but specific enough. Let's craft them as bullet points maybe numbered. Let's ensure no SQL queries or implementation detail requests. Ok produce final answer accordingly
